oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Marvel of the 20th Century! Jim Key- the Wonder of the Age in Animal Education
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Beautiful Jim Key was an intelligent horse who performed for nine years around the country to large crowds at expositions, world's fairs, schools, and other venues. He demonstrated his ability to read, write, spell, and in this photograph, sort mail.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Animals in human situations -- 1890-1900; Animals in human situations -- 1900-1910
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This item is a brochure (printed like a newspaper) advertising Jim Key's visit to Columbus, Ohio. The show was called "the marvel of the 20th century," and was sponsored in part by the Columbus Humane Society. The cover image shows Jim Key sorting mail.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Animals in human situations -- 1890-1900; Animals in human situations -- 1900-1910
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This item is a small yellow card indicating membership in the Jim Key Band of Mercy. The members pledged to be kind to animals. The card includes a photograph of Jim Key.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Beautiful Jim Key with Dr. Key and Monk in front of white house
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jim Key was a talented horse who was able to perform numerous tricks that showcased his intelligence and unique personality. His trainer, Dr. William Key, was an ex-slave who championed patience and kindness as the keys to successful horse training.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Beautiful Jim Key (Horse); Key, William, -- 1883-1909
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dr. William Key stands next to Beautiful Jim Key in front of a large white house, presumably at home in Shelbyville, TN. Monk can be seen sitting in a nearby chair, and another person is sitting in a chair near a door.
